com.gieseckedevrient.smartcard
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  com.gieseckedevrient.smartcard.Session

public class Session
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents a session to a secure element which is available within the phone system.
This class allows the establishment of a communication (basic or logical) channel for an APDU transfer.

Method Summary
 void close()
          Closes this Session.
 void closeChannels()
          Closes all open channels provided by this Session.
 byte[] getAtr()
          Get the Answer to Reset of the secure element reachable by this session.
 Reader getReader()
          Returns the secure element reader that provides this Session.
 boolean isClosed()
          Checks if this channel is closed.
 Channel openBasicChannel(byte[] aid)
          Get an access to the default selected applet (with aid null) or to the applet referenced by the aid over a basic channel.
 Channel openLogicalChannel(byte[] aid)
          Get an access to the default selected applet (with aid null) or to the applet referenced by the aid over a logical channel (this means that an OPEN LOGICAL CHANNEL command will be performed implicitly).
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Method Detail

openBasicChannel

public Channel openBasicChannel(byte[] aid)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Get an access to the default selected applet (with aid null) or to the applet referenced by the aid over a basic channel. The obtained object is an instance of the Channel class.

Parameters:
aid - of the applet which shall be selected on the secure element or null for using the default selected applet.
Returns:
a basic channel object that can be used for communication.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if an internal error occurs.
java.security.AccessControlException - if the access control conditions are not fulfilled.
java.io.IOException - if opening the basic channel or applet selection failed.

openLogicalChannel

public Channel openLogicalChannel(byte[] aid)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Get an access to the default selected applet (with aid null) or to the applet referenced by the aid over a logical channel (this means that an OPEN LOGICAL CHANNEL command will be performed implicitly). The obtained object is an instance of the Channel class.

Parameters:
aid - of the applet which shall be selected on the secure element or null for using the default selected applet.
Consider: aid is mandatory for the secure element UICC
aid - of the applet which shall be selected on the secure element or null for using the default selected applet.
Returns:
a logical channel object that can be used for communication.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if an internal error occurs.
java.security.AccessControlException - if the access control conditions are not fulfilled.
java.io.IOException - if opening the logical channel or applet selection failed.

close

public void close()
Closes this Session.
Consider: After closing this session it can't be used for communication any more.

isClosed

public boolean isClosed()
Checks if this channel is closed.

Returns:
if the channel is closed.

getAtr

public byte[] getAtr()
Get the Answer to Reset of the secure element reachable by this session. The returned byte array can be null, which means the reader cannot provide the ATR for the secure element.

getReader

public Reader getReader()
Returns the secure element reader that provides this Session.

closeChannels

public void closeChannels()
Closes all open channels provided by this Session.
